project_abstract.cdata: The project will provide 19,700 (13,500 boys and 6,200 girls) school places in 9 new secondary schools, by the extension of 6 other existing schools and in 3 new agricultural training centers. The new places to be financed under the proposed credit would account for some 43% of the total secondary school places to be provided for in the Four-Year Plan. Further, equipment will be provided for 16 other schools to give better education and training for another 27,000 students. Boarding accommodation will be provided in the project for 6,200 students of whom 4,300 will be boys and 1,900 girls.
